meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Andrew Knebel Susannah Rosenblatt Patrick Morrison Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6324.

td.p: Andrew Knebel, a classical violist from Norwalk, Connecticut
Susannah Rosenblatt, a writer and communications strategist from Arlington, Virginia
Patrick Morrison, a student of Slavic Studies from Northville, Michigan (whose 2-day cash winnings total $51,101)

tr.td: CANALS
FOOD TALK
AMERICAN "H"ISTORY
CARPENTRY & CONSTRUCTION
SIMILAR-SOUNDING WORDS
OSCAR-WINNING CO-STARS

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', 'During the 20th century, many of the canals in this largest Dutch city were filled in to provide streets & parking spaces')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: During the 20th century, many of the canals in this largest Dutch city were filled in to provide streets & parking spaces

tr.td: Patrick
Susannah
Andrew

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex: There was some controversy over the discovery of calculus, and this man was the head of the Academy of Sciences where?)
...
(Alex: [To Patrick] Newton\'s rival was Leibniz, who was head of the Academy of Sciences... in [*].)
AndrewWhat is Paris?
$6,000
SusannahWhat is Paris?
$4,600
PatrickWhat is Berlin?
$10,000
Berlin')
